meanings.definition: Bacteroids: a type of bacteria found in the intestines of humans and other animals.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that bacteroids in our intestines help with digestion.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the role of bacteroids in maintaining gut health.
meanings.sent3: The bacteroids in our stomachs must be having a party with all the food they get!
meanings.sent4: Like tiny workers, bacteroids diligently break down food in our intestines.
meanings.sent5: I imagined the bacteroids in my gut as tiny, helpful creatures working hard to keep me healthy.

meanings.definition: Bacteroids: a group of bacteria that are able to fix nitrogen.
meanings.sent1: Farmers rely on bacteroids to enrich the soil with nitrogen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are fascinated by the ability of bacteroids to fix nitrogen.
meanings.sent3: The bacteroids in the soil must be the superheroes of plant growth!
meanings.sent4: In the world of bacteria, bacteroids are like the nitrogen-fixing champions.
meanings.sent5: The bacteroids work like magic, turning nitrogen into plant food for better growth.
